intro: Leucocrinum, commonly known as the white lily of the Nile, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant has narrow, strap-like leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. Leucocrinum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period typically occurs in late spring to early summer.
